intro: Boscia madagascariensis, commonly known as the African wild apricot, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, orange-red berries that are a source of food for various animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
